title: Can artificial intelligence replace the human touch in beauty? - VOGUE India
summary:
Can artificial intelligence replace the human touch in beauty?

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Vogue India

The article explores the growing role of artificial intelligence (AI) in the beauty industry, highlighting both its potential and limitations. While AI tools can analyze skin conditions and recommend products, many users find that they lack the personalized care and empathy that human experts provide.

  • AI is becoming prevalent in skincare consultations.
  • Some users have mixed experiences with AI-based skin analyzers comparing to consultations with dermatologists.
  • Experts caution that AI cannot fully replace human understanding and sensitivity in beauty care.
  • Brands are increasingly blending AI technology with human expertise to enhance customer experiences.
“While I was looking to update my skincare routine, artificial intelligence alone couldn't convince me to spend thousands on eight new products.”

In conclusion, while AI in skincare offers exciting advancements, it currently lacks the empathy and nuanced understanding that personal interactions with beauty professionals provide.
newTitle: Can AI Replace Human Touch in Beauty?

summary:

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Samsung News

The latest updates from Samsung include the introduction of two larger sizes for the Galaxy Ring, expanding its wearable options, set to launch during the Galaxy Unpacked event.

Samsung has introduced two new larger sizes for the Galaxy Ring, its lightweight health and wellness wearable. The Galaxy Ring is now available in eleven sizes, ranging from size 5 to size 15, with size 14 and size 15 being the new additions. These new sizes will be available for purchase starting January 22, coinciding with the company’s first Galaxy Unpacked event of 2025.

  • The new sizes are available for purchase starting January 22.
  • The Galaxy Ring features a durable, lightweight design made from Grade 5 titanium.
  • It has an IP68 rating for dust and water resistance, able to withstand up to 100 metres depth.
  • Samsung claims a battery life of up to seven days per charge.
  • Updates to the Samsung Health app focus on sleep, wellness, and integration with SmartThings.
“The Galaxy Ring supports Galaxy AI for generating detailed health reports focused on various health metrics.”

These new developments position Samsung's Galaxy Ring and Health app at the forefront of health and wellness technology.
